name: Koki
description: A Cameroonian steamed bean cake made from black-eyed peas or cowpeas, wrapped in banana leaves and cooked until firm. It's a popular snack or side dish.
recipe: Soak the black-eyed peas overnight, then grind them into a smooth paste.
Mix the paste with finely chopped onions, palm oil, salt, and chopped chili peppers.
Spoon the mixture onto banana leaves and wrap them securely.
Steam the wrapped packages for about 45 minutes until firm.
Unwrap and serve hot as a snack or side dish.
